title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. Even after closing and reopening the data set editor, the issue persists.
EB: The data set editor page should display the children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the query tab. The behavior should persist even after closing and reopening the data set editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without any SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor in the query tab.
3. In the data set editor, go to the data source page.
4. Change the data source to one that has no database, table, or column information.
5. Verify that the children node listing is not displayed.
6. Close the data set editor.
7. Reopen the data set editor.
8. Verify that the issue still exists and the children node listing is not displayed.
